triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a control architecture specifically designed for autonomous mobile agents operating in dynamic environments.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The TouringMachines architecture is developed to handle multi-agent worlds where agents must reason about other agents' intentions and goals.

triples.name: Behavior-based robotics
triples.relevance: The paper addresses reactive control as one component of its hybrid architecture, building on behavior-based robotics principles.

triples.name: Causal model
triples.relevance: The architecture enables agents to construct and project causal models to hypothesize other agents' goals and predict conflicts.

triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: The paper is specifically designed for controlling autonomous mobile agents that can move and interact in their environments.
